concept-wr.title: Licensing Requirements
concept-wr.shortdesc: To install and use Titanium Server, you require a license from Wind River.

dd.p: You can use an evaluation license to try out Titanium Server. This is a fully functional, time-limited license, provided for evaluation purposes only.
You can use a product license to operate Titanium Server for your business requirements.

conbody.draft-comment: US75548 Titanium Server CPE - new details added for licensing

dd.p: You can use an evaluation license to try out Titanium Server CPE. This is a fully functional, time-limited license, provided for evaluation purposes only.
You can use a Titanium Server CPE product license to install Titanium Server CPE.

conbody.p: For complete information about Wind River licenses and licensing terms, contact your Wind River sales representative.

section.title: Obtaining a License
section.p: To obtain a license, contact your Wind River sales representative. The license is sent to the contact email address you provide when you make a request or place an order.

section.title: Installing a License
section.p: To install a license initially, follow the procedure for installing and configuring the Titanium Server system. During this procedure, you must copy the license file to a designated license directory on the controller host. The default designated directory is /home/wrsroot; you can specify a different one during installation.

section.title: Updating a License
section.p: After you have installed a license, you can update it by copying the new license file to the designated license directory on the active controller host, and then running the license-install utility as shown in the following example.

note.p: Wind River recommends that you update licenses before they expire. Manual recovery of VMs may be required if the license is upgraded after expiry.

section.title: Operational Behavior with Expired or Invalid Licenses
section.p: Titanium Server and Titanium Server CPE assume the operational behavior described below when an expired or invalid license is detected.
Mismatched licenses are considered invalid. For example, a Titanium Server license is considered an invalid license if the server is installed and provisioned as a Titanium Server CPE product.
Expired and invalid licenses cause the following behavior:

li.p: A service log (401.003) is logged every 1 hour.
A service alarm (400.003) is triggered 8 hours after the expired or invalid license is detected, and every 1 hour thereafter.
72 hours after the expired or invalid license is detected for the first time, the controller stops service.
